it might be a pinched nerve, or a nerve under temporary pressure from the way your body is positioned

HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!A heat sensation or sudden feeling of warmth can be a sign of blood clot or deep vein thrombosis. It can also be due to pinched nerve or due to diabetic neuropathy. If you are a female and on birth control pills, then this could be due to the side effect of pills as they can also cause deep vein thrombosis. For diagnosis first a duplex ultrasound or color dopplar would need to be done. If this is negative then a nerve conduction study and test for diabetes. If there is a chance then if everything else is negative, then lupus may need to be tested for.Please consult your PCP for primary examination followed by proper referral. Take care!

question: I've been having this warm feeling in my feet, legs just for few seconds it goes away for a while then coms back i asked my family dr he didn't know and didn't seem to be concern at all shall i be concern and what do i need to test for????
title: warm feeling
